Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay in West Berlin”
Reviews.Author: mvgregg
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few instances where I've stayed at a hotel I didn't reserve myself. My wife's aunt, whom we were meeting in Berlin, had stayed at the hotel a number of times, booked the room as an early anniversary present for us. We flew into Berlin and took the train and metro to a stop near the hotel. Although the hotel turned out to be in walking distance to the hotel, the area wasn't particularly pedestrian friendly and the streets entered the area at odd angles making it difficult to navigate on foot to the hotel. The hotel itself was extremely nice and located in a more quiet area nearby. Our room was quite plush and the bathroom was huge--even by American standards. The only criticism I have is that the day we were there, it was unusually hot for Berlin, and the room had no air conditioning; however, when we arrived in our room, the large windows were open and there was a nice-sized fan set up. It turned out that the evening was much cooler and the fan worked great. We did have coffee at the restaurant the day we arrived and had a nice breakfast in the morning. All in all, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary & reminiscence. Great, Brilliant, well worth it ...”
Reviews.Author: Sue'n'Pete
Reviews.Content: Overall - well worth every penny. Paying for the VIP extra's was so-so worthwhile (including a room upgrade / robes etc). We were so very very happy with this hotel. The most helpful (excellent & English speaking) & knowledgeable reception staff. Its friendly morning & evening restaurant staff. The excellent cleaners who were very quiet until about 0930hrs each day. Everyone within the hotel was just great. Overall - brilliant. Good / excellent clean & spacious rooms at the rear of the hotel were brilliant... There was also a fitness suite & swimming pool .. Would we stay here again = Definitely & likely try another upgrade ... Recommended to all .. & it is also very nearby to Theodor Heuss Platz U-Bahn so it is most easily within close travel of all the city sites. City Travel (inc tours) can be easily arranged via reception ... "Sehr Danke" ...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lancellot
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel on business and I found to be hotel to be very conveniently located to the conference centre and metro. Service was outstanding as was the very comfortable accomdation. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: NautiusMaximus
Reviews.Content: This hotel doesn't look much from outside, and indeed walking into the lobby area hardly fills one with confidence, but first appearances can be very deceptive. I was extremely pleased with this hotel. I chose the hotel because I was going to a conference at the nearby ICC, and it was indeed only a short walk away. It's not the closest hotel to the conference centre (that's probably the Ibis), but it's close enough, and I'm sure it's far more comfortable than the Ibis would have been. If you're there to see the sights of Berlin, however, there are probably many better located hotels. The staff get top marks for their attitude. Friendly, professional, and helpful. They spoke excellent English, but only if required. I speak reasonably good German (although it's not perfect, and people can generally tell I'm English by the time I've uttered about 3 words), which is more than adequate to cope with the sort of discussions you have with hotel staff, and I find it quite patronising if people speak back to me in English. They didn't. But they did speak to my colleagues, who don't speak German, in flawless English. That's the way it should be. A nice feature of the hotel is the swimming pool. OK, it's not exactly Olympic sized, but for a hotel this size in a city centre location it was very respectable. Bedrooms were clean and comfortable, with very nicely kitted out bathrooms. My only quibble is that there was no safe in the bedroom, but this is a minor point. No doubt the hotel would have found somewhere secure to stash valuables if I'd had anything of any great importance. Breakfast was fine. A rather limited selection of hot food, but an excellent cold buffet. The sausages in the hot food were very good. The main negative thing to be aware of is that the communual facilities in the hotel are less than you'd usually expect in a 4* hotel. This wasn't a problem for us, because we spend so much time doing things related to the conference we were attending, but if you were expecting to sit in a nice hotel lounge, you'd be disappointed. As far as I could tell, if you wanted to sit with friends or colleagues over a beer, you'd need to do so at a table in the restaurant. But overall, I was very happy with this place, and would definitely stay there again if I were going to another conference at the ICC.

Reviews.Title: “Beuatiful breakfast, beuatiful waitress too.”
Reviews.Author: BUTENUDE
Reviews.Content: Good, if compact, sauna steam room and exercise area with free apples and German Newspapers. Ask for slippers, bathrobes and extra towels at reception. The swimming pool is long enough for exercise swimming before breakfast, and though it is only wide enough for three, that was enough. Breakfast buffet was one of the best German style we have eaten, with cooked British components also available. All the staff were very helpful, and the inadequacy of our German was no problem. The room had a nice balcony and mini kitchen. Internet access was only partially working during our stay, but they were getting it fixed. We were too busy to have dinner in the hotel as planned, which we much regretted, and will certainly sample it next time as it looked good and sensibly produced for small numbers. Amazing low internet price for a capital city.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and relaxing place to stay when discovering Berlin”
Reviews.Author: pathfinderHolland
Reviews.Content: It is a small hotel located in a residential area of Berlin. Not directly in the center but well connected with underground and S-Bahn is only 25 minutes from the Postdamer Platz or the Museum Island. Tranquile and with Wellness (swimming pool and sauna) this hotel is ideal as a base camp to discover Berlin. Very friendly staff did arrange for tickets and gave advice. We had an spacious double room with balcon, confortable bathroom; bathtube and two washing sinks. The room was confortable and relaxing, but the indirect lightening worked out too dark when looking for things in cupboards. We found good restaurants in the area and cheaper than the touristic restaurants more in the centre like Kurfuerstendam. With the internet rate we had an excellent value for money. I can only recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: AoifeMN
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a weekend break in November of this year. It is a small bit outside the main shopping areas but a cab was only about €10. I went with 8 friends, there is a small but lovely pool and spa area. It is a small hotel and the staff are very friendly and had no problem booking tickets to things for us. The price was very cheap and overall I would consider this hotel excellent valus for money.
